verse: Then God said, “Let us  make a man and a woman  in our image  to be like us.  Let them reign over the fish of the sea, the birds of the air, the livestock, over the creatures that creep along the ground,  and over the wild animals.”
commentary: Yahweh made us in his image for us to reign like him on earth over every other living thing. That desire has not changed.

verse: Enoch walked with God for three hundred years after Methuselah was born and had many other sons and daughters. Enoch and God walked together as intimate friends; then God took him to himself,  and he was seen no more.
commentary: Friendship is what Yahweh always desired and that is what Adam and Eve forfeited in the garden but he has not stopped desiring that. It is also evident in his choice of 12 disciples as his friends when he walked among us
